title: Revive Thy Work O Lord

author.name: Albert Midlane
author.bio: Albert Midlane was a prolific English hymn writer known for his evangelical hymns and children's songs. Midlane's hymns are characterized by their clear call to devotion and spiritual awakening, focusing on themes of revival, prayer, and the power of God's work. Despite facing personal tragedies, his faith remained steadfast, and his hymns continue to inspire and encourage believers around the world to seek a deeper relationship with God. 'Revive Thy Work O Lord' is one of his most enduring hymns, calling for spiritual renewal and divine intervention.

lyrics:
1. Revive thy work, O Lord,
Thy mighty arm make bare;
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead,
And make Thy people hear.

2. Revive thy work, O Lord,
Disturb this sleep of death;
Quicken the smould'ring embers now
By Thine almighty breath.

3. Revive thy work, O Lord,
Create soul-thirst for Thee;
And hung'ring for the Bread of Life
O may our spirits be.

4. Revive thy work, O Lord,
Exalt Thy precious name;
And, by the Holy Ghost, our love
For Thee and Thine inflame.

5. Revive thy work, O Lord,
Give Pentecostal show'rs;
The glory shall be all Thine own,
The blessing, Lord, be ours.
